verses.text: On the eighth day, Moses called Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
verses.comment: Follows the Hebrew text, introducing the start of priestly service.

verses.text: He said to Aaron, 'Take for yourself a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both without blemish, and offer them before Yahweh.'
verses.comment: Retains 'Yahweh' for faithfulness to the Tetragrammaton; both offerings must be flawless.

verses.text: And speak to the people of Israel, saying, 'Take a male goat for a sin offering, and a calf and a lamb, both a year old and without blemish, for a burnt offering,'
verses.comment: Clarifies animal ages and types; 'calf' in context is a young bull.

verses.text: 'also an ox and a ram for peace offerings, to offer before Yahweh, and a grain offering mixed with oil. For today Yahweh will appear to you.'
verses.comment: "Peace offerings" clarifies Hebrew 'shelamim'; promise of Yahweh's manifestation.

verses.text: And they brought what Moses commanded before the Tent of Meeting; and all the congregation drew near and stood before Yahweh.
verses.comment: Uses "Tent of Meeting" for the Hebrew "Ohel Mo'ed".

verses.text: Moses said, 'This is what Yahweh commanded you to do, so that the glory of Yahweh may appear to you.'
verses.comment: Glory refers to Yahweh's manifest presence.

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron, 'Draw near to the altar and offer your sin offering and your burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and for the people; then offer the offering of the people and make atonement for them, as Yahweh has commanded.'
verses.comment: Keeps 'atonement' language for the Hebrew 'kippur.'

verses.text: So Aaron approached the altar and killed the calf of the sin offering, which was for himself.
verses.comment: Aaron must first make offering for himself before serving the people.

verses.text: Aaron's sons brought the blood to him, and he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar, and poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.comment: Detailed description follows sacrifice protocol.

verses.text: But the fat and the kidneys and the fat covering the liver from the sin offering, he burned on the altar, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Lists organs and fat as prescribed in Levitical law.

verses.text: The flesh and the skin he burned with fire outside the camp.
verses.comment: Sacrificial remains not consumed on the altar are burned outside.

verses.text: He killed the burnt offering, and Aaron's sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it on all sides of the altar.
verses.comment: Follows burnt offering procedure with blood.

verses.text: They brought him the burnt offering piece by piece, including the head, and he burned them on the altar.
verses.comment: Organizes the offering according to ritual.

verses.text: He washed the entrails and the legs and burned them with the burnt offering on the altar.
verses.comment: Entrails and legs require washing, then burning.

verses.text: He presented the people's offering. He took the goat for the sin offering, which was for the people, and killed it and offered it for sin, like the first one.
verses.comment: Parallel procedure for the people's sin offering.

verses.text: He presented the burnt offering and offered it according to the regulation.
verses.comment: "Regulation" refers to Levitical instructions.

verses.text: He presented the grain offering and took a handful from it and burned it on the altar, besides the burnt offering of the morning.
verses.comment: "Handful" clarifies Hebrew ritual; ties to the daily burnt offering.

verses.text: He killed the ox and the ram, the sacrifice of the peace offerings for the people. Aaron's sons gave him the blood, and he sprinkled it on the altar all around.
verses.comment: Peace offerings provided for communal fellowship.

verses.text: The fat portions of the ox and the ram—the fat tail, and the fat covering the innards, and the kidneys and the fat covering the liver—
verses.comment: Detail of sacrificial anatomy is preserved.

verses.text: they put the fat portions on the breasts, and he burned the fat portions on the altar.
verses.comment: Fat portions are burned as portion for Yahweh.

verses.text: But the breasts and the right thigh Aaron waved as a wave offering before Yahweh, as Moses commanded.
verses.comment: Wave offering denotes ritual presentation before God.

verses.text: Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them. He came down from offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings.
verses.comment: Blessing gesture is preserved from the Hebrew.

verses.text: Moses and Aaron went into the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people, and the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the people.
verses.comment: Yahweh's glory appears after collective blessing.

verses.text: Fire came out from before Yahweh and consumed the burnt offering and the fat on the altar. When all the people saw it, they shouted and fell on their faces.
verses.comment: Preserves the awe and worship of the witness of divine fire, consistent with original Hebrew.
